text.0: they who stand round him as he moves harness the bright the ruddy steed.
text.1: the lights are shining in the sky.
text.2: on both sides to the car they yoke the two bay coursers dear to him.
text.3: bold tawny bearers of the chief.
text.4: thou making light where no light was and form o men where form was not.
text.5: wast born together with the dawns.
text.6: thereafter they as is their wont threw off the state of babes unborn.
text.8: thou indra with the tempestgods the breakers down of what is firm.
text.9: foundest the kine even in the cave.
text.10: worshipping even as they list singers laud him who findeth wealth.
text.12: mayest thou verily be seen coming by fearless indras side.
text.13: both joyous equal in your sheen.
text.14: with indras well beloved hosts the blameless hastening to heaven.
text.16: come from this place o wanderer or downward from the light of heaven.
text.17: our songs of praise all yearn for this.
text.18: indra we seek to give us help from here from heaven above the earth.
